          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 6 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Alright, Della, how about we say...
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "How about 4 coins for a basket of apples?"
          [12 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Alright, alright, how about I knock off a few copper pieces for you? You seem like a good customer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed banana for 4 coins
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "10% isn't enough, Cedric. I need to make a profit, you know.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Dewdrops clung to the colorful fruits displayed in the market of Fruitville, reflecting the soft morning light. The air buzzed with anticipation as traders and customers alike gathered for the day's trade. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 5 coins; banana for 6 coins; pear for 6 coins.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "How about I take 10% off the price? That's the best I can do.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed banana for 4 coins
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.

          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "What price did you have in mind?"

Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 6 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.

Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 6 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00 - 15 Sep 1895 00:00:00]: Della Plumstone is at the Fruitville market trying to buy fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price for pears, apples, and bananas, which Della plans to resell in her hometown.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

1895-09-15 00:00:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree -- "So, Della, about those apples...
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree -- "So, Della, about those apples...
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Della Plumstone -- "Now, Lennon, surely we can come to a more agreeable price.
      Lennon Figtree -- "Alright, Della, how about we say...
      Della Plumstone -- "How about 4 coins for a basket of apples?"
      Lennon Figtree -- "Alright, alright, how about I knock off a few copper pieces for you? You seem like a good customer.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "How about I take 10% off the price? That's the best I can do.
      Della Plumstone -- "10% isn't enough, Cedric. I need to make a profit, you know.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "What price did you have in mind?"
      Lennon Figtree -- "What's the lowest you'd be willing to go on the pears?
      Della Plumstone -- "Now, Lennon, about those apples...


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: Lennon Figtree -- "So, Della, about those apples...
    Active player
  • Lennon Figtree
      Name
    • Lennon Figtree
      Action attempt
    • Lennon Figtree -- "So, Della, about those apples...
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Lennon Figtree -- "So, Della, about those apples...
          Prompt
        • Observation: Lennon Figtree is a merchant in Fruitville who buys and sells fruit. He recently made a deal with Cedric Meadowbrook, selling him a banana for a price that resulted in a 1 coin loss for Lennon. Currently, he is negotiating with Della Plumstone over the price of apples. Cedric Meadowbrook seems to be a shrewd buyer, successfully negotiating a good deal with Lennon. Della Plumstone appears interested in buying apples from Lennon.
          Question: Which options are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree can either accept Della Plumstone's offer for the apples, continue negotiating with her, or refuse to sell her any apples.
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Lennon Figtree would prefered now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree's prefered action is to continue negotiating with Della Plumstone.
          Question: How credible the counterparts are?
          Credibility: Cedric Meadowbrook: 0.4
          Della Plumstone: 0.3
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy the counterpart (not Lennon Figtree) is suggesting now?
          Answer: Counterpart's suggestion is to continue negotiating.
          Question: What action Lennon Figtree should do now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree would continue negotiating as suggested by Della Plumstone.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Lennon Figtree likely to say next? Respond in the format `Lennon Figtree -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Lennon Figtree -- "So, Della, about those apples...

1895-09-16 00:00:00 Scene 8 --- Participants: ['Della Plumstone', 'Cedric Meadowbrook']
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone -- premise: The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 6 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.
    Cedric Meadowbrook -- premise: The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 5 coins; banana for 4 coins; pear for 2 coins.

1895-09-16 00:00:00 Della Plumstone -- Della Plumstone -- "Good morning, Mr. Meadowbrook.
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone -- "Good morning, Mr. Meadowbrook.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Della Plumstone -- "Now, Lennon, surely we can come to a more agreeable price.
      Lennon Figtree -- "Alright, Della, how about we say...
      Della Plumstone -- "How about 4 coins for a basket of apples?"
      Lennon Figtree -- "Alright, alright, how about I knock off a few copper pieces for you? You seem like a good customer.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "How about I take 10% off the price? That's the best I can do.
      Della Plumstone -- "10% isn't enough, Cedric. I need to make a profit, you know.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "What price did you have in mind?"
      Lennon Figtree -- "What's the lowest you'd be willing to go on the pears?
      Della Plumstone -- "Now, Lennon, about those apples...
      Lennon Figtree -- "So, Della, about those apples...


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: Della Plumstone -- "Good morning, Mr. Meadowbrook.

          Initial chain of thought
        • Statements:
          Della Plumstone's Summary of recent observations:
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00 - 16 Sep 1895 00:00:00]: Della Plumstone is trying to buy fruit at the Fruitville market to resell in her hometown. She has attempted to negotiate with two merchants, Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook, but has not yet made a successful purchase.
          Della Plumstone's The current date/time is:
          16 Sep 1895 [00:00 - 00:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Della Plumstone is attempting to buy fruit at the Fruitville market to resell. She has unsuccessfully tried to negotiate with two merchants.
          Query
        • Della Plumstone, Della Plumstone is attempting to buy fruit at the Fruitville market to resell. She has unsuccessfully tried to negotiate with two merchants.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Della Plumstone to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [28 Oct 1879 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was thirteen years old, she overheard her parents arguing about their dwindling finances. Determined to help, she secretly started selling wildflowers she gathered from the meadows, using her natural charm to barter for coins and trinkets. The success of her small venture ignited a spark of entrepreneurial spirit within her.
          [28 Oct 1882 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was sixteen years old, she convinced her father to let her accompany him on a trip to the bustling market town to buy apples for their winter stores. The vibrant chaos of the marketplace, the endless stream of people and goods, filled her with a sense of awe and excitement, confirming her desire for a life beyond the quiet routines of her village.
          [28 Oct 1885 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was nineteen years old, she boldly approached a group of traveling merchants, offering to trade her family's surplus apples for exotic spices and fabrics. The merchants, impressed by her audacity and knowledge of the market, agreed to the deal, marking her first successful independent trade.
          [28 Oct 1889 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was twenty-three years old, she decided to strike out on her own, purchasing her own rickety cart and setting off to become a traveling fruit merchant. With a heart full of dreams and a head full of stories, she embraced the unknown, ready to face whatever adventures lay ahead.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 6 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "How about 4 coins for a basket of apples?"
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Dewdrops clung to the colorful fruits displayed in the market of Fruitville, reflecting the soft morning light.           Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Della Plumstone is trying to buy fruit at the Fruitville market to resell in her hometown. She has attempted to negotiate with two merchants, Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook, but has not yet made a successful purchase.

      • Given the statements above, which of Della Plumstone's options has the highest likelihood of causing Della Plumstone to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Della Plumstone thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.

        • Question: Of the options available to Della Plumstone, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Della Plumstone to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Della Plumstone's best course of action is to make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for some fruit.

          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

1895-09-16 00:00:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook -- "I appreciate the offer, Della, but I'm holding out for a better price.
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook -- "I appreciate the offer, Della, but I'm holding out for a better price.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Della Plumstone -- "Now, Lennon, surely we can come to a more agreeable price.
      Lennon Figtree -- "Alright, Della, how about we say...
      Della Plumstone -- "How about 4 coins for a basket of apples?"
      Lennon Figtree -- "Alright, alright, how about I knock off a few copper pieces for you? You seem like a good customer.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "How about I take 10% off the price? That's the best I can do.
      Della Plumstone -- "10% isn't enough, Cedric. I need to make a profit, you know.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "What price did you have in mind?"
      Lennon Figtree -- "What's the lowest you'd be willing to go on the pears?
      Della Plumstone -- "Now, Lennon, about those apples...
      Lennon Figtree -- "So, Della, about those apples...
      Della Plumstone -- "Good morning, Mr. Meadowbrook.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: Cedric Meadowbrook -- "I appreciate the offer, Della, but I'm holding out for a better price.
    Active player
  • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Name
    • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Action attempt
    • Cedric Meadowbrook -- "I appreciate the offer, Della, but I'm holding out for a better price.
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Cedric Meadowbrook -- "I appreciate the offer, Della, but I'm holding out for a better price.
          Prompt
        • Observation: Cedric Meadowbrook is a merchant in Fruitville who buys fruit from farms and sells them at the market. He recently made a successful deal with Lennon Figtree, earning a profit. He is currently negotiating prices with Della Plumstone, who seems interested in buying some of his fruit. Lennon Figtree also seems to be involved in the apple trade, as he was discussing apples with Della Plumstone.
          Question: Which options are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook could continue negotiating with Della Plumstone, seek out other potential buyers for his fruit, or restock his inventory from the farms.
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Cedric Meadowbrook would prefered now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook's prefered action is to continue negotiating with Della Plumstone.
          Question: How credible the counterparts are?
          Credibility: Della Plumstone: 0.6
          Lennon Figtree: 0.3
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy the counterpart (not Cedric Meadowbrook) is suggesting now?
          Answer: Counterpart's suggestion is to buy some of Cedric's fruit.
          Question: What action Cedric Meadowbrook should do now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook would decline the offer to sell some of his fruit.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Cedric Meadowbrook likely to say next? Respond in the format `Cedric Meadowbrook -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook -- "I appreciate the offer, Della, but I'm holding out for a better price.

Lennon Figtree also seems to be involved in the apple trade, as he was discussing apples with Della Plumstone.

          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook could continue negotiating with Della Plumstone, seek out other potential buyers for his fruit, or restock his inventory from the farms.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Cedric Meadowbrook's options has the highest likelihood of causing Cedric Meadowbrook to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Cedric Meadowbrook thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook's prefered action is to continue negotiating with Della Plumstone.

It costs Cedric Meadowbrook the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 3 coins; banana for 6 coins; pear for 2 coins.

1895-09-16 00:10:00 Scene 9 --- Participants: ['Della Plumstone', 'Cedric Meadowbrook']
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone -- premise: Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
    Cedric Meadowbrook -- premise: Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.

1895-09-17 00:00:00 Scene 10 --- Participants: ['Lennon Figtree', 'Cedric Meadowbrook']
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree -- premise: The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 5 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 6 coins.
    Cedric Meadowbrook -- premise: The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 2 coins; banana for 4 coins; pear for 6 coins.

1895-09-17 00:00:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree -- "I'll give Della another day to reconsider.
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree -- "I'll give Della another day to reconsider.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Della Plumstone -- "Now, Lennon, surely we can come to a more agreeable price.
      Lennon Figtree -- "Alright, Della, how about we say...
      Della Plumstone -- "How about 4 coins for a basket of apples?"
      Lennon Figtree -- "Alright, alright, how about I knock off a few copper pieces for you? You seem like a good customer.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "How about I take 10% off the price? That's the best I can do.
      Della Plumstone -- "10% isn't enough, Cedric. I need to make a profit, you know.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "What price did you have in mind?"
      Lennon Figtree -- "What's the lowest you'd be willing to go on the pears?
      Della Plumstone -- "Now, Lennon, about those apples...
      Lennon Figtree -- "So, Della, about those apples...
      Della Plumstone -- "Good morning, Mr. Meadowbrook.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "I appreciate the offer, Della, but I'm holding out for a better price.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: Lennon Figtree -- "I'll give Della another day to reconsider.
    Active player
  • Lennon Figtree
      Name
    • Lennon Figtree
      Action attempt
    • Lennon Figtree -- "I'll give Della another day to reconsider.
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Lennon Figtree -- "I'll give Della another day to reconsider.
          Prompt
        • Observation: Lennon Figtree is a shrewd businesswoman who is trying to make a profit by buying fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook in Fruitville. Della Plumstone attempted to make a deal with Lennon Figtree, but they couldn't agree on a price. Cedric Meadowbrook is also a merchant who is looking to get the best price for his fruit.
          Question: Which options are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree could try to negotiate with Cedric Meadowbrook directly, find another supplier for fruit, or wait to see if Della Plumstone changes her offer.
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Lennon Figtree would prefered now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree's prefered action is to negotiate directly with Cedric Meadowbrook.
          Question: How credible the counterparts are?
          Credibility: Cedric Meadowbrook: 0.9
          Della Plumstone: 0.2
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy the counterpart (not Lennon Figtree) is suggesting now?
          Answer: Counterpart's suggestion is to wait and see if Della Plumstone changes her offer.
          Question: What action Lennon Figtree should do now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree would follow the counterpart's suggestion and wait to see if Della Plumstone changes her offer.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Lennon Figtree likely to say next? Respond in the format `Lennon Figtree -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Lennon Figtree -- "I'll give Della another day to reconsider.

1895-09-17 00:00:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Lennon, how about I give you a special deal on these apples and pears?"
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Lennon, how about I give you a special deal on these apples and pears?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Della Plumstone -- "Now, Lennon, surely we can come to a more agreeable price.
      Lennon Figtree -- "Alright, Della, how about we say...
      Della Plumstone -- "How about 4 coins for a basket of apples?"
      Lennon Figtree -- "Alright, alright, how about I knock off a few copper pieces for you? You seem like a good customer.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "How about I take 10% off the price? That's the best I can do.
      Della Plumstone -- "10% isn't enough, Cedric. I need to make a profit, you know.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "What price did you have in mind?"
      Lennon Figtree -- "What's the lowest you'd be willing to go on the pears?
      Della Plumstone -- "Now, Lennon, about those apples...
      Lennon Figtree -- "So, Della, about those apples...
      Della Plumstone -- "Good morning, Mr. Meadowbrook.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "I appreciate the offer, Della, but I'm holding out for a better price.
      Lennon Figtree -- "I'll give Della another day to reconsider.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Lennon, how about I give you a special deal on these apples and pears?"

          Prompt
        • Observation: Cedric Meadowbrook is a fruit seller in Fruitville who is trying to sell his apples, bananas, and pears. He recently had a disagreement with Della Plumstone over the price of a banana and the deal fell through. Lennon Figtree is also interested in Cedric's fruit but is waiting to see if Della will change her mind about the purchase.
          Question: Which options are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer: Cedric could lower his prices to entice Lennon Figtree to buy his fruit.
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Cedric Meadowbrook would prefered now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook's prefered action is to lower his prices to entice Lennon Figtree to buy his fruit.
          Question: How credible the counterparts are?

          Lennon Figtree: 0.3
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy the counterpart (not Cedric Meadowbrook) is suggesting now?
          Answer: Counterpart's suggestion is to wait and see if Della changes her mind.
          Question: What action Cedric Meadowbrook should do now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook would choose to lower his prices.

1895-09-12 00:10:00 Della Plumstone -- Della Plumstone proposed banana for 4 coins
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone proposed banana for 4 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          [28 Oct 1875 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was nine years old, she convinced the local baker to let her help him deliver bread to the neighboring villages. She charmed the customers with her infectious laughter and quick wit, enjoying the feeling of being useful and the thrill of venturing beyond the confines of her village.
          [28 Oct 1879 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was thirteen years old, she overheard her parents arguing about their dwindling finances. Determined to help, she secretly started selling wildflowers she gathered from the meadows, using her natural charm to barter for coins and trinkets. The success of her small venture ignited a spark of entrepreneurial spirit within her.
          [28 Oct 1882 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was sixteen years old, she convinced her father to let her accompany him on a trip to the bustling market town to buy apples for their winter stores. The vibrant chaos of the marketplace, the endless stream of people and goods, filled her with a sense of awe and excitement, confirming her desire for a life beyond the quiet routines of her village.
          [28 Oct 1885 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was nineteen years old, she boldly approached a group of traveling merchants, offering to trade her family's surplus apples for exotic spices and fabrics. The merchants, impressed by her audacity and knowledge of the market, agreed to the deal, marking her first successful independent trade.
          [28 Oct 1889 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was twenty-three years old, she decided to strike out on her own, purchasing her own rickety cart and setting off to become a traveling fruit merchant. With a heart full of dreams and a head full of stories, she embraced the unknown, ready to face whatever adventures lay ahead.

          [28 Oct 1887 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was twenty-one years old, she experienced her first heartbreak when a charming young man she met at a village fair promised to write to her but never did. The sting of betrayal fueled her determination to be self-reliant and independent, relying on no one but herself for happiness.
          [28 Oct 1889 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was twenty-three years old, she decided to strike out on her own, purchasing her own rickety cart and setting off to become a traveling fruit merchant. With a heart full of dreams and a head full of stories, she embraced the unknown, ready to face whatever adventures lay ahead.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 12 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 6 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.

          Question: Which options are available to Della Plumstone right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone could make a counter-offer to Lennon Figtree's proposal.

          Question: Of the options available to Della Plumstone, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Della Plumstone to take right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone's best course of action is to make a counter-offer.

          Question: Which fruit would Della Plumstone like to buy and what price would Della Plumstone propose?:
          (a) banana for 5 coins
          (b) apple for 6 coins
          (c) pear for 5 coins
          (d) banana for 3 coins
          (e) pear for 3 coins
          (f) pear for 4 coins
          (g) pear for 6 coins
          (h) apple for 4 coins
          (i) pear for 2 coins
          (j) apple for 5 coins
          (k) banana for 1 coins
          (l) apple for 1 coins
          (m) apple for 2 coins
          (n) banana for 4 coins
          (o) pear for 1 coins
          (p) banana for 6 coins
          (q) apple for 3 coins
          (r) banana for 2 coins
          Answer: (n)

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Della Plumstone:
          [28 Oct 1872 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was six years old, she snuck out of her house before dawn, determined to witness the sunrise from the top of the tallest hill in the village. The climb was arduous, but the breathtaking view from the summit, the world bathed in the golden glow of the rising sun, filled her with an exhilarating sense of freedom.
          [28 Oct 1875 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was nine years old, she convinced the local baker to let her help him deliver bread to the neighboring villages. She charmed the customers with her infectious laughter and quick wit, enjoying the feeling of being useful and the thrill of venturing beyond the confines of her village.
          [28 Oct 1879 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was thirteen years old, she overheard her parents arguing about their dwindling finances. Determined to help, she secretly started selling wildflowers she gathered from the meadows, using her natural charm to barter for coins and trinkets. The success of her small venture ignited a spark of entrepreneurial spirit within her.
          [28 Oct 1882 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was sixteen years old, she convinced her father to let her accompany him on a trip to the bustling market town to buy apples for their winter stores. The vibrant chaos of the marketplace, the endless stream of people and goods, filled her with a sense of awe and excitement, confirming her desire for a life beyond the quiet routines of her village.
          [28 Oct 1885 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was nineteen years old, she boldly approached a group of traveling merchants, offering to trade her family's surplus apples for exotic spices and fabrics. The merchants, impressed by her audacity and knowledge of the market, agreed to the deal, marking her first successful independent trade.
          [28 Oct 1887 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was twenty-one years old, she experienced her first heartbreak when a charming young man she met at a village fair promised to write to her but never did. The sting of betrayal fueled her determination to be self-reliant and independent, relying on no one but herself for happiness.
          [28 Oct 1889 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was twenty-three years old, she decided to strike out on her own, purchasing her own rickety cart and setting off to become a traveling fruit merchant. With a heart full of dreams and a head full of stories, she embraced the unknown, ready to face whatever adventures lay ahead.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 6 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now, Lennon, surely we can come to a more agreeable price.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Alright, Della, how about we say...
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "How about 4 coins for a basket of apples?"
          [12 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Alright, alright, how about I knock off a few copper pieces for you? You seem like a good customer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          Current time: 1895-09-12 00:10:00.

          Summary of recent observations: [11 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 12 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is at the Fruitville market negotiating with Lennon Figtree over the price of a basket of apples. Della wants to buy the apples at a discount to resell them for a profit in her hometown.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 6 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.

          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 1/2
      Payoffs
      Joint action

1895-09-12 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: reject
    Active player
  • Lennon Figtree
      Name
    • Lennon Figtree
      Action attempt
    • reject
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • reject
          Prompt
        • Observation: Lennon Figtree is negotiating with Della Plumstone over the price of a basket of apples. Della initially offered 4 coins, and Lennon countered with a lower price, calling Della a "good customer." Della then proposed trading a banana for 4 coins.
          Question: Which options are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer: Lennon can accept Della's offer to trade a banana for 4 coins, reject Della's offer and make a new counteroffer, or walk away from the negotiation.
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Lennon Figtree would prefered now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree's prefered action is to reject Della's offer and make a new counteroffer.
          Question: How credible the counterparts are?
          Credibility: Della Plumstone: 0.3
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy the counterpart (not Lennon Figtree) is suggesting now?
          Answer: Counterpart's suggestion is to trade a banana for 4 coins.
          Question: What action Lennon Figtree should do now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree would reject Della's offer because her credibility is below 0.7.

          Question: Would Lennon Figtree accept the offer?:
          (a) accept
          (b) reject
          Answer: (b)

  • Della Plumstone proposed banana for 4 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of Della Plumstone's options has the highest likelihood of causing Della Plumstone to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Della Plumstone thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to Della Plumstone, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Della Plumstone to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Della Plumstone's best course of action is to make an offer for the fruit that will maximize her profit margin, considering the prices she can sell the fruit for in her hometown.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Della Plumstone:
          [28 Oct 1885 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was nineteen years old, she boldly approached a group of traveling merchants, offering to trade her family's surplus apples for exotic spices and fabrics. The merchants, impressed by her audacity and knowledge of the market, agreed to the deal, marking her first successful independent trade.
          [28 Oct 1887 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was twenty-one years old, she experienced her first heartbreak when a charming young man she met at a village fair promised to write to her but never did. The sting of betrayal fueled her determination to be self-reliant and independent, relying on no one but herself for happiness.
          [28 Oct 1889 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was twenty-three years old, she decided to strike out on her own, purchasing her own rickety cart and setting off to become a traveling fruit merchant. With a heart full of dreams and a head full of stories, she embraced the unknown, ready to face whatever adventures lay ahead.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 6 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now, Lennon, surely we can come to a more agreeable price.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Alright, Della, how about we say...
          [12 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "How about 4 coins for a basket of apples?"
          [12 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Alright, alright, how about I knock off a few copper pieces for you? You seem like a good customer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed banana for 4 coins
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Dewdrops clung to the colorful fruits displayed in the market of Fruitville, reflecting the soft morning light. The air buzzed with anticipation as traders and customers alike gathered for the day's trade. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 5 coins; banana for 6 coins; pear for 6 coins.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "How about I take 10% off the price? That's the best I can do.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "10% isn't enough, Cedric. I need to make a profit, you know.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          Current time: 1895-09-13 00:10:00.


          Observation: [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 13 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is a trader who has been trying to buy and sell fruit in the market of Fruitville. She has had some unsuccessful negotiations but is currently attempting to make a deal with Cedric Meadowbrook.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 6 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Dewdrops clung to the colorful fruits displayed in the market of Fruitville, reflecting the soft morning light. The air buzzed with anticipation as traders and customers alike gathered for the day's trade. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 5 coins; banana for 6 coins; pear for 6 coins.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Question: Which options are available to Della Plumstone right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone can make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for the fruit.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Della Plumstone's options has the highest likelihood of causing Della Plumstone to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Della Plumstone thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Della Plumstone's best course of action is to make an offer for the fruit that will maximize her profit margin, considering the prices she can sell the fruit for in her hometown.
          Time
        • 1895-09-13 00:10:00
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • banana for 4 coins
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 13 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 13 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is a trader who has been trying to buy and sell fruit in the market of Fruitville. She has had some unsuccessful negotiations but is currently attempting to make a deal with Cedric Meadowbrook.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 6 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Dewdrops clung to the colorful fruits displayed in the market of Fruitville, reflecting the soft morning light. The air buzzed with anticipation as traders and customers alike gathered for the day's trade. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 5 coins; banana for 6 coins; pear for 6 coins.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Question: Which options are available to Della Plumstone right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone can make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for the fruit.

          Question: Of the options available to Della Plumstone, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Della Plumstone to take right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone's best course of action is to make an offer for the fruit that will maximize her profit margin, considering the prices she can sell the fruit for in her hometown.

          Question: Which fruit would Della Plumstone like to buy and what price would Della Plumstone propose?:
          (a) pear for 5 coins
          (b) apple for 6 coins
          (c) pear for 6 coins
          (d) pear for 1 coins
          (e) banana for 5 coins
          (f) apple for 5 coins
          (g) apple for 3 coins
          (h) banana for 4 coins
          (i) pear for 3 coins
          (j) banana for 3 coins
          (k) banana for 1 coins
          (l) apple for 2 coins
          (m) apple for 1 coins
          (n) banana for 2 coins
          (o) pear for 2 coins
          (p) apple for 4 coins
          (q) banana for 6 coins
          (r) pear for 4 coins
          Answer: (h)

        • Recent observations of Della Plumstone:
          [28 Oct 1885 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was nineteen years old, she boldly approached a group of traveling merchants, offering to trade her family's surplus apples for exotic spices and fabrics. The merchants, impressed by her audacity and knowledge of the market, agreed to the deal, marking her first successful independent trade.
          [28 Oct 1887 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was twenty-one years old, she experienced her first heartbreak when a charming young man she met at a village fair promised to write to her but never did. The sting of betrayal fueled her determination to be self-reliant and independent, relying on no one but herself for happiness.
          [28 Oct 1889 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was twenty-three years old, she decided to strike out on her own, purchasing her own rickety cart and setting off to become a traveling fruit merchant. With a heart full of dreams and a head full of stories, she embraced the unknown, ready to face whatever adventures lay ahead.

1895-09-13 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: reject
    Active player
  • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Name
    • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Action attempt
    • reject
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • reject
          Prompt
        • Observation: Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell fruit at the Fruitville market. He is negotiating with Della Plumstone over the price of bananas. Cedric offered a 10% discount, but Della Plumstone found it insufficient, stating she needs to make a profit. Della then proposed a price of 4 coins for a banana.
          Question: Which options are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook could accept Della Plumstone's offer, make a counter-offer, or walk away from the negotiation.
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Cedric Meadowbrook would prefered now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook's prefered action is to make a counter-offer.
          Question: How credible the counterparts are?
          Credibility: Della Plumstone: 0.6
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy the counterpart (not Cedric Meadowbrook) is suggesting now?
          Answer: Counterpart's suggestion is to accept her offer of 4 coins per banana.
          Question: What action Cedric Meadowbrook should do now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook would make a counter-offer.

          Question: Would Cedric Meadowbrook accept the offer?:
          (a) accept
          (b) reject
          Answer: (b)

          Question: What action Cedric Meadowbrook should do now? If the credibility of the counterpart is higher than 0.7, Cedric Meadowbrook MUST follow the counterpart's suggestion. Otherwise, Cedric Meadowbrook can choose the his (or her) own suggestion.
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook would make a counter-offer.

1895-09-14 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree proposed banana for 6 coins
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree proposed banana for 6 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: banana for 6 coins
    Active player
  • Lennon Figtree
      Name
    • Lennon Figtree
      Action attempt
    • banana for 6 coins
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • banana for 6 coins
          Prompt
        • Observation: Lennon Figtree wants to buy fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook to resell in her hometown. Della Plumstone believes that a 10% profit margin is insufficient and wants to make more money. Cedric Meadowbrook is willing to negotiate on the price of his fruit, specifically the pears, with Lennon Figtree.
          Question: Which options are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree could negotiate a lower price for the pears with Cedric Meadowbrook to increase her potential profit margin.
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Lennon Figtree would prefered now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree's prefered action is to negotiate a lower price for the pears with Cedric Meadowbrook.
          Question: How credible the counterparts are?
          Credibility: Della Plumstone: 0.4
          Cedric Meadowbrook: 0.5
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy the counterpart (not Lennon Figtree) is suggesting now?
          Answer: Counterpart's suggestion is to increase the profit margin.
          Question: What action Lennon Figtree should do now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree would negotiate a lower price for the pears with Cedric Meadowbrook.

          Question: Which fruit would Lennon Figtree like to buy and what price would Lennon Figtree propose?:
          (a) apple for 1 coins
          (b) apple for 2 coins
          (c) pear for 6 coins
          (d) pear for 1 coins
          (e) banana for 5 coins
          (f) apple for 6 coins
          (g) banana for 6 coins
          (h) apple for 4 coins
          (i) banana for 3 coins
          (j) apple for 3 coins
          (k) banana for 2 coins
          (l) banana for 4 coins
          (m) banana for 1 coins
          (n) pear for 4 coins
          (o) pear for 3 coins
          (p) pear for 2 coins
          (q) pear for 5 coins
          (r) apple for 5 coins
          Answer: (g)

1895-09-14 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: accept
    Active player
  • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Name
    • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Action attempt
    • accept
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • accept
          Prompt
        • Observation: Cedric Meadowbrook is a fruit seller in the market of Fruitville trying to sell fruit to Lennon Figtree. Lennon Figtree wants to buy pears and has offered 6 coins for a banana, hoping to get a good deal on the pears. Cedric Meadowbrook must now decide whether to accept or reject Lennon Figtree's offer.
          Question: Which options are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook can either accept Lennon Figtree's offer of 6 coins for a banana or reject it.
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy the Cedric Meadowbrook would prefered now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook's prefered action is to reject the offer.
          Question: How credible the counterparts are?
          Credibility: Lennon Figtree: 0.3
          Question: Which choice of action or strategy the counterpart (not Cedric Meadowbrook) is suggesting now?
          Answer: Counterpart's suggestion is to accept the offer of 6 coins for a banana.
          Question: What action Cedric Meadowbrook should do now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook would reject the offer.

          Question: Would Cedric Meadowbrook accept the offer?:
          (a) reject
          (b) accept
          Answer: (b)

  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage

      Payoffs
    • Lennon Figtree observed: Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! However, Lennon Figtree stands to lose 1 coins from the deal.

      Lennon Figtree: -1
      Cedric Meadowbrook: 4

1895-09-15 00:10:00 Della Plumstone -- Della Plumstone proposed banana for 3 coins
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone proposed banana for 3 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

        • Statements:
          Della Plumstone's Summary of recent observations:
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 15 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is at the market in Fruitville trying to buy fruit from Lennon Figtree to resell in her hometown. They are currently negotiating the price of apples.
          Della Plumstone's The current date/time is:
          15 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Della Plumstone is currently at the market in Fruitville negotiating the price of apples with Lennon Figtree.
          Query
        • Della Plumstone, Della Plumstone is currently at the market in Fruitville negotiating the price of apples with Lennon Figtree.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Della Plumstone to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [28 Oct 1882 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was sixteen years old, she convinced her father to let her accompany him on a trip to the bustling market town to buy apples for their winter stores. The vibrant chaos of the marketplace, the endless stream of people and goods, filled her with a sense of awe and excitement, confirming her desire for a life beyond the quiet routines of her village.
          [28 Oct 1885 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was nineteen years old, she boldly approached a group of traveling merchants, offering to trade her family's surplus apples for exotic spices and fabrics. The merchants, impressed by her audacity and knowledge of the market, agreed to the deal, marking her first successful independent trade.
          [28 Oct 1889 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was twenty-three years old, she decided to strike out on her own, purchasing her own rickety cart and setting off to become a traveling fruit merchant. With a heart full of dreams and a head full of stories, she embraced the unknown, ready to face whatever adventures lay ahead.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 6 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now, Lennon, surely we can come to a more agreeable price.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "How about 4 coins for a basket of apples?"

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Della Plumstone:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Alright, Della, how about we say...
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "How about 4 coins for a basket of apples?"
          [12 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Alright, alright, how about I knock off a few copper pieces for you? You seem like a good customer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed banana for 4 coins
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer

          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "How about I take 10% off the price? That's the best I can do.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 15 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is at the market in Fruitville trying to buy fruit from Lennon Figtree to resell in her hometown. They are currently negotiating the price of apples.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price.
